abstract: Researchers and several big tech firms, including Samsung and Fujitsu, are working at University of Surrey to create mobile Internet speeds more than 100 times faster than anything now available; work on so-called fifth generation, or 5G, wireless technology, which would vastly speed up download times on smartphones, is scheduled to be finished in early 2018.

headline.print_headline: Heated Race to Upgrade Web Speed on Phones
headline.main: 5G Is a New Frontier for Mobile Carriers and Tech Companies

snippet: Fed by users’ appetite for watching videos, the world’s largest carriers are rushing to offer ultrafast wireless technology first. Some of their efforts will be on display this week at the Mobile World Congress.
lead_paragraph: Fed by users’ appetite for watching videos, the world’s largest carriers are rushing to offer ultrafast wireless technology first. Some of their efforts will be on display this week at the Mobile World Congress.
